safecaR_recalls

safecaR_recalls.Rmd

Introduction

The safecaR package provides a tidy interface to NHTSA APIs, including crash ratings, recalls, and complaints.

This article focuses on the recalls API, which provides access to vehicle recall information reported to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).

Using the recalls interface, you can:

  • List available model years, makes, and models

  • Retrieve detailed recall records for individual vehicles

All functions return tibbles, making them easy to use in data analysis pipelines.

Listing Model Years 

# List available years in the NHTSA repository
years <- list_recall_years()
head(years)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 1
#>   modelYear
#>   <chr>    
#> 1 1949     
#> 2 1950     
#> 3 1951     
#> 4 1952     
#> 5 1953     
#> 6 1954

Listing Makes for a Year 

# List makes for 2022
makes <- list_recall_makes(2022)
head(makes)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 2
#>   modelYear make         
#>   <chr>     <chr>        
#> 1 2022      4 STAR       
#> 2 2022      ABS REMORQUES
#> 3 2022      ACURA        
#> 4 2022      ADAM         
#> 5 2022      AIRSTREAM    
#> 6 2022      ALAMO GROUP

Listing Models for a Make and Year 

# List models for Acura in 2022
models <- list_recall_models(2022, "Acura")
head(models)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 3
#>   modelYear make  model
#>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>
#> 1 2022      ACURA RDX  
#> 2 2022      ACURA RDX  
#> 3 2022      ACURA MDX  
#> 4 2022      ACURA MDX  
#> 5 2022      ACURA ILX  
#> 6 2022      ACURA TLX

Retrieving Recalls 


recalls <- get_recalls(2022, "ACURA", "RDX")
head(recalls)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 14
#>   manufacturer           nhtsaCampaignNumber parkIt parkOutSide overTheAirUpdate
#>   <chr>                  <chr>               <lgl>  <lgl>       <lgl>           
#> 1 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE           
#> # ℹ 9 more variables: reportReceivedDate <chr>, component <chr>, summary <chr>,
#> #   consequence <chr>, remedy <chr>, notes <chr>, modelYear <chr>, make <chr>,
#> #   model <chr>

Retriving Recalls by Campaign Number 

recalls <- get_recalls_by_campaign_number("24V064000")
head(recalls)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 15
#>   manufacturer           nhtsaCampaignNumber parkIt parkOutSide overTheAirUpdate
#>   <chr>                  <chr>               <lgl>  <lgl>       <lgl>           
#> 1 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE           
#> 2 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE           
#> 3 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE           
#> 4 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE           
#> 5 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE           
#> 6 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE           
#> # ℹ 10 more variables: reportReceivedDate <chr>, component <chr>,
#> #   potentialNumberofUnitsAffected <int>, summary <chr>, consequence <chr>,
#> #   remedy <chr>, notes <chr>, modelYear <chr>, make <chr>, model <chr>

Notes

  • Function inputs are case-insensitive. For example, “ACURA”, “Acura”, and “acura” are all valid.

  • All outputs are tidy tibbles for easy integration with dplyr or ggplot2.
